item.description:
Our next Brookline Book Club meeting will be the last Sunday of April at Bruegger's, Coolidge Corners. The selection we'll be discussing is "The Glass Castle" by Jeannette Walls. It's been out in paperback for a couple of years but it's received almost universal praise. It's a memoir that you won't soon forget. Although I read it almost three years ago, I often think about the difficult life she endured growing up and I've asked myself what part of that life led to a successful career and a seemingly well adjusted life as an adult. Several of her siblings were scarred by the shared experience but she seems to have survived and flourished.
I think you'll really enjoy the book and it should generate some interesting discussion.
Several people have asked that we choose books in advance so we've chosen "The Thirteenth Tale" by Diane Setterfield for May (a week early, on the 23rd) and "The Book Thief" by Marcus Zusak for our June meeting.
Hope to see you all soon. Happy reading. Elaine

group.name: The Brookline Book Club Meetup Group

item.name: Brookline Book Club
